personal.name: Tony James
personal.title: Application Development Manager
personal.summary: As a forward-thinking individual with a passion for technology, I am constantly seeking out new ways to innovate and improve upon existing systems. Whether I am working on a new project or collaborating with a team, my focus is always on driving progress and finding creative solutions to complex problems. I am excited to see where my love of technology will take me next, and I am always looking for new opportunities to learn and grow in this exciting field.

highlights: Translated stakeholder requirements into maintainable, modular software with rigorous testing
Aligned architecture with business needs through lean approaches & innovative technology utilization
Introduced NoOps, reducing DevOps reliance, accelerating deployment cycles and reducing costs
Increased productivity and collaboration by migrating from Azure to Jira
Executed end-to-end developer sourcing, screening, interviewing, and skill testing for dozens of devs
Managed extensive contractor sourcing and onboarding for rapid turnaround of essential work
Reduced technical debt by over 90%, minimizing bugs and downtime with comprehensive tracking
Transformed from 90% outsourced team to a 90% in-house model using Spotify squad structure
Established 5 high-performing squads totaling over 30 developers, elevating delivery pace & quality
Leading a team of 10 offshore developers
Working on Laravel API's
Introduced PHPunit testing and grew coverage up to 90+ %
Mentoring and performing code reviews
Working on Laravel Restful API's
Using Docker (Deployable)
Performing code reviews
Writing PHPUnit tests
Working under Agile methodologies
Senior developer on the global McDonald's Monopoly project, serving ~13 million users
Built two AWS Lambda functions and API gateway integrated with Dynamo DB for MMA app
Boosted user engagement by adding new prize paths on Monopoly site, integrated with multiple APIs
Improved system performance and stability using Blazemeter for load testing

experience.description: Actively contributing as a Backend Laravel Developer within a cybersecurity-focused organisation, primarily working on API development and integrations.

Oversaw the strategic planning and development of the Vitality pass-through API solution designed for Prudential Brazil and Argentina. This integral API solution will facilitate the processing of over 50 million insurance policies, activating and revoking the Vitality benefits package based on specific insurer rules.
highlights: Took on a leading role, contributing to 90% of the API development, which involved meticulous design, coding, testing, and optimization
Initiated the adoption of a test-driven development (TDD) approach, resulting in enhanced code quality, easier maintenance, and expedited debugging processes
Successfully mitigated bugs and regression by over 95%, bolstering the reliability and performance of the API, thereby streamlining the benefits management for millions of insurance policies

experience.description: A significant portion of my role involved modernising legacy systems, transitioning them into more efficient and standardised Laravel-based frameworks.
highlights: Developed a REST API adhering to the OCPI specification to deliver charge point data to Mercedes, ensuring real-time and accurate data transfer
Constructed a data export system that feeds into Palantir's big data platform, capable of processing over 1 million records on each export, thereby enhancing data-driven decision-making capabilities
Engineered an offer management system integrated with OVO Energy, streamlining the offer creation and distribution process
Developed the Workplace Plus system, a comprehensive solution that offers managed free charging to client employees, contributing to corporate sustainability goals
Sole backend developer for all Laravel framework projects
Planned, implemented and deployed biggest budget site ever fulfilled by Bonfire (Star Medical)
Connected Star with the BroadBean API for live job feeds
Configured a synchronisation mechanism for jobs to be redistributed based on country (UK, IE and Europe)
